snippet: Aging is no longer measured by crow’s feet and saggy jowls but by the top part of the hands, where the skin is thinner and tends to crinkle over time.
abstract: Many older women, seeking to remove telltale signs of age from their hands, are getting 'hand lifts'; quick plastic surgery procedure involves injecting synthetic fillers to plump up the skin along with the use of lasers to remove sun spots.
lead_paragraph: Aging is no longer measured by crow’s feet and saggy jowls but by the top part of the hands, where the skin is thinner and tends to crinkle over time.

headline.seo: Treating Hands for Signs of Aging — Skin Deep
headline.main: Hands Give a Lift, Now They Can Get One
headline.print_headline: Hands Give a Lift, Now They Can Get One
